votes.title: H.Res. 771 - Standing with Israel
votes.description: Resolution expressing support for Israel in its defense against Hamas and other terrorist organizations following October 7, 2023 attacks
votes.significance: First major congressional response after October 7th attacks

votes.title: H.R. 6126 - Israel Security Supplemental Appropriations Act
votes.description: $14.3 billion emergency aid package for Israel including $4B for Iron Dome, $1.2B for Iron Beam defense system
votes.significance: First major aid package after October 7th, proposed offsetting costs by cutting IRS funding

votes.title: H.Con.Res. 57 - Supporting the State of Israel
votes.description: Concurrent resolution reaffirming U.S. support for Israel and its right to self-defense
votes.significance: Broad bipartisan resolution before October 7th attacks

votes.title: H.R. 8034 - Israel Security Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2024
votes.description: $14.3 billion supplemental appropriations including $8.7B in direct military aid, $3.5B for Foreign Military Financing, $4B for missile defense, $1.2B for Iron Beam
votes.significance: Largest single aid package to Israel in U.S. history, part of $95B foreign aid package

votes.title: Senate Foreign Aid Package (Israel portion)
votes.description: $26 billion total for Israel-related spending: $15B military aid, $9B humanitarian aid for Gaza, $2.4B for regional U.S. operations
votes.significance: Bipartisan Senate passage of comprehensive aid package including Ukraine and Taiwan

votes.title: S.J.Res. 114 - Block Tank Round Sales to Israel
votes.description: Joint Resolution of Disapproval to block $20 million sale of tank rounds to Israel (120mm High Explosive Anti-Tank Multi-Purpose cartridges)
votes.significance: First Senate vote to potentially block weapons sales to Israel, led by Sen. Bernie Sanders

votes.title: S.J.Res. 115 - Block Mortar Sales to Israel
votes.description: Joint Resolution of Disapproval to block $774.1 million sale of mortar rounds to Israel
votes.significance: Second Sanders resolution to block weapons sales amid Gaza humanitarian concerns

votes.title: S.J.Res. 116 - Block JDAMs Sales to Israel
votes.description: Joint Resolution of Disapproval to block $61.1 million sale of Joint Direct Attack Munitions (JDAMs) to Israel
votes.significance: Record number of senators vote to restrict weapons to Israel (highest was 19)

notes.methodology: Pro-Israel votes are defined as votes supporting military aid, weapons sales, and resolutions expressing support for Israel. Votes to block aid or weapons sales are considered anti-Israel positions in this tracking system.
notes.dataIntegrity: All vote counts, dates, and bill numbers verified against official Congress.gov records and House/Senate Clerk roll call databases.
notes.limitations: This dataset focuses on major Israel-related legislation. It does not include every mention of Israel in appropriations bills or non-binding statements.
